title: Trump Demands Lisa Cook Resign From Fed Board
description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Wally Adeyemo, former US Deputy Treasury Secretary under the Biden Administration, discusses how President Trump’s pressure campaign to get Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook to resign attacks the Fed’s independence. Danielle DiMartino Booth, QI Research CEO & Chief Strategist, on what to expect to hear from Federal Reserve Chairman Powell's speech at Jackson Hole. Leon Panetta, Former US Secretary of Defense, on what security guarantees the US and Europe should give to Ukraine. Databank CEO, Raul Martynek, on can the US energy grid support the demand from AI, and Rob Bonta (D) California Attorney General talks about California joining the growing redistricting war. (Source: Bloomberg)

argos_summary: The broadcast covers President Trump’s recent attack on Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, citing alleged mortgage fraud and calling for her resignation, and the potential impact on the Fed’s independence ahead of the Jackson Hole symposium where Chair Jerome Powell is expected to speak. It also discusses Trump’s AI executive orders that loosen restrictions on data‑center development, the surge in demand for AI infrastructure, and the energy‑consumption concerns that accompany it. In addition, the program reports on political battles over redistricting, with California’s attorney general defending the state’s proposed map against a Texas‑style gerrymandering challenge, and touches on broader national security and law‑enforcement issues raised by the administration. Overall, the show highlights tensions between executive power, institutional independence, and economic policy in the current political climate.
